message.body: Borges9, hello again
Are u still in Japan?
Oh, no my cousin is in japan. im in philly
He's stationed there. i may have lost service when i was in my office.
Oh. Sorry.
Do you think we are the only people in the study
no i've texted with a few others
Oh cool. I've texted with an study employee and you. That's it.
I may have texted with a study employee. our convo didnt go very far.
Mine was fun.
Hm, maybe it was my fault then
I wasnt really on
Maybe he/she wasn't
How is your day going
Well, great, but im dodging work really
I should be applying for jobs but ive just been playing music all morning
How about you ?
Well I'm in Baltimore! And it's so cute!!
Oh cool. i've never been. what are you doing there?
Visiting a friend. It's super cute
Lots of thrift stores and coffee shops.
So you teach at temple right?
Yeah but i didnt get summer teaching, so im looking for a summer job right now
What do you teach?
Freshman composition and creative writing
I really want to teach!
Ta-Ed a freshman class this past semester. I loved it.
I used to ta in my undergrad and it was great. But the freshman are special. They are so excited about life! Being at college! Dating! School! Everythingis new and exciting
Yeah i really like it too, but i'm not sure if i want to adjunct for too long
Yeah no money
What else do you want to do?
ly the case anymore. id like to work with un/underemployed but maybe in some other capacity.
I used to work as a ged prep instructor, which was fulfilling in that the degree (usually) helped people to find work, but im not sure that this is real
Yeah teaching arts/humanity does not lead many people to practical Jobs. But it creates culture and nurtures passion and idealism.
Which society should be more financially supportive of.
What abt you? where are you studying? why are you studying?
I happen to believe that America, more than ever, needs more critical discourse and creative thinkers v

I'm studying at an art school in boston. Im studying design. Working on a thesis. Why? I believe that the design and incorporation of new technologiesinto our society could hurt certain aspects of humanity that I don't want to see lost.
Heavy shit
Or corny
So text msging is not one of those corrosive technologies? :D
That's why I signed up
Cause it totally isn't about technology being bad
Do you know john durham peters? he wrote a book called 'speaking into the air' abt the effects of technology on interpesonal relationships
It's just that we can use technology in ways that hurt us.
I think
No I should probably read that book
I'm reading a bunch of stuff this summer but right now I'm working on a Brazilian philosopher flusser.
Especially when ur best friend wants to take u thrifting
Yeah that's true. that's one reason iÂ¿e also thought abt getting into media literacy
It's hard ;(
Yeah MIT has essentially a media literacy program I think.i want to take classes there next year.
Super interesting
Oh he has a kafka essay that i read in undergrad
No way!! I had never heard of him before.
That's so cool.
Yeah i just looked him up--he's czech born
Oh I thought he was from brazil
Wch maybe explains the kafka interest
Yeah you're right, he was a brazilian citizen
Your work sounds really interesting!
I've read some excerpts from an essay on photography. But today I'm reading an essay in thought and reflection.
Being a student is interesting
Galavanting around the northeast on summer vacay is also interesting.
I was back in Philly for a couple nights this week.
It's so fun there
Everyone wants to have a good time
Do you remember the Kafka essay?
Cool, how was it being back?
Awesome! I love it!
I went to the el bar to do some day drinking with my old roommates. I couldn't imagine anything better.
That sounds really pleasant. havent been to the el bar in forever!
I only remember that flusser's article had something to do with codes, and that it focused primarily on the castle. maybe the rest would come back slowly.
